oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bulgaria. A relatively short organic history
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Apostolov, Stoylko
Heeb, Marlene
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Values, standards and certification
Bulgaria
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic agriculture in Bulgaria has a relatively short history. The concept of organic agriculture was only introduced after the fall of the communist regime in 1990, when the process of land restitution started. Below is an account of developments over the following thirteen years and a report on the current status of organic agriculture in the country.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Apostolov, Stoylko and Heeb, Marlene (2003) Bulgaria. A relatively short organic history. The Organic Standard (31), pp. 2-6.
